page.title: 05CONSERVATION-FOREST OF DEAN
page.content: The conservation of the forest is a major objective of the{Forestry {Commission.}The size{(22,500 acres)}is staying the same and they are maintaining the balance between the variety of trees. There are{160 } different species of animals and birds but the most destructive is the{deer.} These are kept under control by Rangers but poachers also shoot them. The{Wye Valley}is a designated {"area of outstanding natural beauty"} and the wooded slopes are of high conservation value. The forestry Commission has close links with the { {Royal Society for the Protection of {Birds}and the{Gloucester Trust for {Nature Conservation.} Waymarked paths, forest trails campsites, car parks, litter bins educational visits and so on are also provided by the Commission.
